member.name: T:EMK.Collections.SortableList
member.summary: The SortableList allows to maintain a list sorted as long as needed. If no IComparer interface has been provided at construction, then the list expects the Objects to implement IComparer. If the list is not sorted it behaves like an ordinary list. When sorted, the list's "Add" method will put new objects at the right place. As well the "Contains" and "IndexOf" methods will perform a binary search.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Since no IComparer is provided here, added objects must implement the IComparer interface.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. Since no IComparer is provided, added objects must implement the IComparer interface.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.#ctor(System.Collections.IComparer)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Will be used to compare added elements for sort and search operations.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.#ctor(System.Collections.IComparer,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Will be used to compare added elements for sort and search operations.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Add(System.Object)
member.summary: IList implementation. If the KeepSorted property is set to true, the object will be added at the right place. Else it will be added at the end of the list.
member.returns: The index where the object has been added.
member.exception: The SortableList is set to use object's IComparable interface, and the specifed object does not implement this interface.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Contains(System.Object)
member.summary: IList implementation. Search for a specified object in the list. If the list is sorted, a BinarySearch is performed using IComparer interface. Else the Object.Equals implementation is used.
member.returns: true if the object is in the list, otherwise false.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.IndexOf(System.Object)
member.summary: IList implementation. Returns the index of the specified object in the list. If the list is sorted, a BinarySearch is performed using IComparer interface. Else the Object.Equals implementation of objects is used.
member.returns: If the object has been found, a positive integer corresponding to its position. If the objects has not been found, a negative integer which is the bitwise complement of the index of the next element.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Clear
member.summary: IList implementation. Idem ArrayList

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: IList implementation. Inserts an objects at a specified index. Cannot be used if the list has its KeepSorted property set to true.
member.param: The index before which the object must be added.
member.exception: The SortableList is set to use object's IComparable interface, and the specifed object does not implement this interface.
Index is less than zero or Index is greater than Count.
If the object is added at the specify index, the list will not be sorted any more and the property is set to true.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: IList implementation. Idem ArrayList
member.param: The object whose value must be removed if found in the list.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: IList implementation. Idem ArrayList

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: IList.ICollection implementation. Idem ArrayList

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.GetEnumerator
member.summary: IList.IEnumerable implementation. Idem ArrayList

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Clone
member.summary: ICloneable implementation. Idem ArrayList

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.IndexOf(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Idem IndexOf(object), but starting at a specified position in the list

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.IndexOf(System.Object,EMK.Collections.SortableList.Equality)
member.summary: Idem IndexOf(object), but with a specified equality function
member.param: Equality function to use for the search.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.IndexOf(System.Object,System.Int32,EMK.Collections.SortableList.Equality)
member.summary: Idem IndexOf(object), but with a start index and a specified equality function
member.param: Equality function to use for the search.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.ToString
member.summary: Object.ToString() override. Build a string to represent the list.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Object.Equals() override.
member.returns: true if object is equal to this, otherwise false.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.GetHashCode
member.summary: Object.GetHashCode() override.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Sort
member.summary: Sorts the elements in the list using ArrayList.Sort. Does nothing if the list is already sorted.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.AddRange(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: If the KeepSorted property is set to true, the object will be added at the right place. Else it will be appended to the list.
member.returns: The index where the object has been added.
member.exception: The SortableList is set to use object's IComparable interface, and the specifed object does not implement this interface.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.InsertRange(System.Int32,System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Inserts a collection of objects at a specified index. Should not be used if the list is the KeepSorted property is set to true.
member.param: The index before which the objects must be added.
member.exception: The SortableList is set to use objects's IComparable interface, and the specifed object does not implement this interface.
Index is less than zero or Index is greater than Count.
If the object is added at the specify index, the list will not be sorted any more and the property is set to true.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.LimitNbOccurrences(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Limits the number of occurrences of a specified value. Same values are equals according to the Equals() method of objects in the list. The first occurrences encountered are kept.
member.param: Value whose occurrences number must be limited.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.RemoveDuplicates
member.summary: Removes all duplicates in the list. Each value encountered will have only one representant.

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.IndexOfMin
member.summary: Returns the object of the list whose value is minimum
member.returns: The minimum object in the list

member.name: M:EMK.Collections.SortableList.IndexOfMax
member.summary: Returns the object of the list whose value is maximum
member.returns: The maximum object in the list

member.name: P:EMK.Collections.SortableList.IsSorted
member.summary: 'Get only' property that indicates if the list is sorted.

member.name: P:EMK.Collections.SortableList.KeepSorted
member.summary: Get : Indicates if the list must be kept sorted from now on. Set : Tells the list if it must stay sorted or not. Impossible to set to true if the list is not sorted. KeepSorted==true implies that IsSorted==true
member.exception: Cannot be set to true if the list is not sorted yet.

member.name: P:EMK.Collections.SortableList.AddDuplicates
member.summary: If set to true, it will not be possible to add an object to the list if its value is already in the list.

member.name: P:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: IList implementation. Gets - or sets - object's value at a specified index. The set operation is impossible if the KeepSorted property is set to true.
member.exception: Index is less than zero or Index is greater than Count.
[] operator cannot be used to set a value if KeepSorted property is set to true.

member.name: P:EMK.Collections.SortableList.IsFixedSize
member.summary: IList implementation. Idem ArrayList

member.name: P:EMK.Collections.SortableList.IsReadOnly
member.summary: IList implementation. Idem ArrayList

member.name: P:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Count
member.summary: IList.ICollection implementation. Idem ArrayList

member.summary: IList.ICollection implementation. Idem ArrayList

member.name: P:EMK.Collections.SortableList.SyncRoot
member.summary: IList.ICollection implementation. Idem ArrayList

member.name: P:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Capacity
member.summary: Idem ArrayList

member.name: T:EMK.Collections.SortableList.Equality
member.summary: Defines an equality for two objects
